sub_title: Marketing & Comms Director | Sustainability and Corporate Responsibility | MBA | B2B/C + not for profit
summary:
A champion for positive impact and change for good, can I bring you my 18+ years experience to help your project or company accelerate their sustainability goals? 

I've directed teams and projects for companies and projects that want to move faster and achieve positive impact goals. I support by taking a birds eye view of what's needed from strategy to resourcing, comms to content, PR to propositions. 

Leading big teams and small ones, it's my mission to bring all the pieces together to make sense of it all. 

Tell me where I can jump in and help out... Or, give me the problem and I'll tell you and be a hands-on extension of your team - making you and your company look great, and make a real difference.

treasury_media.title: JG Consulting
treasury_media.description: A full service consultant covering marketing, communications and strategy for purpose-driven businesses. Based in Amsterdam, but available for remote work across Europe and the UK.

projects.title: Business Travel Journalism Awards: Carlson Wagonlit Travel
projects.description: 2013 saw the tenth annual Business Travel Journalism Awards, organised and promoted by Carlsonwagonlit Travel. I have worked alongside the in-house team on the nomination and judging process for the past three years, every year has seen an increase of at least 35% in entries year-on-year.

profile_positions.description:
Following a successful rebrand project, where I ran the media engagement for the hotel opening and rebrand I: 
- Created a communications strategy (based on business strategy and dovetailed with the brand strategy)
- Directed the process of a new crisis communications procedure and process including a new manual. Subsequently delivered a series of cascade workshops and ongoing training materials. 
- Acted as the central point of contact for crisis communications working with a number of internal stakeholders
- Drafted message houses for the organisation and key topics 
- Identified training needs and arranged bespoke training for senior leadership
- Delivered a series of operational fixes to enhance the department with team members
- Wrote speeches and other communications on behalf of the CEO and executive team 
- Supported new hotel launches and major campaigns with NGOs, investors and suppliers. 
- Created a resourcing proposal for marketing and comms organisational structure 
- Ran a transparent, and multi-stage tender process to procure new agency representation in Italy, and since worked with them to develop a communications strategy for the market
profile_positions.title: Interim Director Communications, The Social Hub

profile_positions.description:
My job is to support companies and teams accelerating their positive impact through communications, marketing, change management, training and strategy.  I select clients and projects careful to align with my ethics and best practice in sustainability. 

My MBA ensures I focus on sustainability and impact, and keep a helicopter perspective over the organisation and projects I work on - rather than focusing on the department or project in silo. 

Projects include: 
Brand strategy development, stakeholder engagement workshop and brand pillars, promise, story tone of voice etc for Travalyst (The sustainable travel foundation set up by Prince Harry) 

Writing and overseeing production of a Sustainability & Impact (internal) training module for sales, marketing and distribution teams on responsible drinking for the world's leading beverage brand

Strategic advisory, resourcing and product marketing for Omnicell Europe Inc (Healthcare)

Spokesperson and connector for drinks brand Avallen (B Corp)

Creating a data vision and digital strategy for NGO Simavi

Post-crisis strategy for scaling up the social enterprise (B Corp) Paper on the Rocks
profile_positions.title: Consultant / Owner

profile_positions.description: Director for climate, sustainability and corporate responsibility clients and projects at Edelman Amsterdam.

profile_positions.title: Full time Executive MBA

profile_positions.description:
- Wrote and delivered strategy for three high growth areas of the business including meetings & events, product and technology and the consultancy division of CWT - a highly complex business in a competitive field. 
- A role with responsibility across the marketing suite including; branding, digital, internal and external comms, content, social, analytics and events was created for me to accelerate, align and drive revenue. 
- Lead international direct and matrix teams in 5 global locations through a huge organisational transformation   
- Identified team strengths and aligned resource to projects and lines of business. Within 3 months had improved digital marketing results year on year by 25% by placing the right people in the right roles.
- Devised and led the first lead generation campaigns for the consultancy division resulting in over achieving KPIs and potential revenue goals 
- Delivered a new website with the team including identification of target personas , writing new tone of voice guidelines, and acted as editor-in-chief of all content. 
-  Responsibility for the full go-to-market for a newly developed SaaS (business insight tool). In my first 6 months in role I directed development of the product brand, story, process, operations and more. Working directly with the product and technology and development teams, I then interfaced to the customer organisation and the wider marketing operational teams. A small window of opportunity for us to be the first in market with this software saw a greatly accelerated campaign and planning - faster than CWT has delivered on any other product.
- Marketing representative on global leadership teams, working closely with sales and customer teams
profile_positions.title: Senior Director, Global Marketing

profile_positions.description:
- As an EMEA marketing leadership team member, I directed external and internal marketing communications strategy and projects for two key markets whilst leading a team of 14 across content, PR, internal communications, digital, events, publications, campaigning, design, social media and partnership marketing for the UK & Ireland and BeNeLux.
- Conceptualised and tested a reorganisation of EMEA team members, sought backing from management peers and then rescoped responsibilities, including centralising and outsourcing where most effective. 
- Created development opportunities for team members to go into regional roles to ensure a higher level of influence and effectiveness to both benefit the organisation and strengthen smaller teams
- Directed annual events strategy for 5 years, including project directing a thought-leadership event which attracted travel and procurement managers responsible for $0.7bn in travel spend in the UK market. Used events as key pillars of content marketing strategy.
- Managed operational marketing budgets 
- While managing the teams, I continued to edit and write content for web, internal and external events, scripts, social media and print magazines. Also published opinion pieces in the trade and national media.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Director (inc internal & external comms) UK, Ireland & Benelux

profile_positions.description:
- During the Olympics we activated a huge campaign to encourage people to come to London 'now' and not wait until the sport was on. We actively encouraging potential visitors to be part of the experience with World Record London campaign and other exciting activities. It was a multi-step PR campaign with a huge number of third parties. 
- Acted as a spokesperson for a variety of international and UK media including live radio, TV, and print including BBC radio and TV, Financial Times, and international news programmes.
- Developed and delivered content for London Media Centre with key partners and stakeholders which included over 600 events for 6000 press in a six week period during the Olympics.
- Managed ongoing press office during major events including London 2012 Olympics, Diamond Jubilee and Royal Wedding, including briefing spokespeople, writing quotes for CEO, the Mayor of London, working with key public figures, athletes and celebrities to promote the city, arts and more.
- Event managed large scale media moments including press dinners for 50+ attendees, press conferences and events in partnership with the Mayor of London’s press team, VisitBritain, the Society of London Theatre, British Fashion Council, LOCOG, and many other key London stakeholders. 
- Managed PR agencies in seven markets and delivered campaigns and news in Europe, US, India & China.
- Strategised, devised, and executed stunts and PR campaigns; curator of London city stories - writing press releases, copy, directing events and promoting London as a key destination to visit.
- Provided statements and crisis messaging for events such as London Riots, protests, and other tourism related incidents for press, CEO and Mayor of London Boris Johnson.
profile_positions.title: PR Manager, Leisure, Corporate & Higher Education

profile_positions.description:
Contributed to Visit London’s overall marketing objectives as part of a busy reactive and proactive press office with sole responsibility for European PR remit, developing media strategies in key European markets. 
- Managed £250,000 PR budget for European markets
- Responsible for briefing and managing the day to day work of European agency network, implementing proactive PR campaigns for each market and evaluating subsequent coverage
- Responded to reactive media enquiries on destination and corporate related issues, including writing statements on behalf of CEO, Chair and other senior spokespeople, acting as a spokesperson at events and briefings in UK and internationally.    
- Briefed press in market at trade fairs and desk-side briefings in France, Germany, Spain and Italy. 
- Organised and hosted press trips, events, stunts and other PR activity with variety of international and national media with partners such as British Airways, Hilton, One Aldwych, Eurostar, for a variety of publications including Die Welt, El Mundo, Geo Saison, Vanity Fair and many more.  
- Managed relationships with relevant domestic and on territory media, producing targeted stories.
- Worked with other stakeholder press teams including VisitBritain, VisitEngland, LDA and GLA as well as hotel, attraction, restaurant and transport partners.
profile_positions.title: European PR Manager

profile_positions.description:
Simultaneously managed upwards of eight client accounts including SAGA, Business Travel Market, Elegant Hotels Group, the Guild of Travel Management Companies, Korean Air, Shangri-La Maldives and Qatar Airways. 
- Managed Korean Air’s pan-European PR agencies, overseeing strategy development, day to day work, reporting, forward planning and issues management.
- Hosted pan-European press trip to India with French, British and German media for Qatar Airways. 
- Successfully directed the PR and ran media centre for b2b business fair, Business Travel Market which launched in June 2009. Managed media liaison pre-event, ensuring quality UK and international media attendance over the two day show.  
- Attended strategic overseas planning meetings for new clients following successful new business pitches, creating, developing and presenting PR strategies to key stakeholders. 
- Heavily contributed to new business proposals for tourism boards, airlines, hotels and b2b products, working regularly on pitching for new business and securing three major account wins including Elegant Resorts, Qatar Airways and Shangri-La Hotels, as well as identifying regular new business leads through industry connections and networking. .  
- Managed the content management system and team to create new company website. 
- Managed work of junior team members.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Clients included: Air Mauritius, BMED (bmi), British Sugar, Egypt Tourist Authority, Feejee & Kiwi Experience, Football Aid, Neilson Active Holidays, Trinidad & Tobago Tourist Board, Universal Orlando Resort. 
- Planned and hosted press familiarisation visits for leading UK national and regional publications.
- Developed and distributed press releases and wrote communications reports and plans for corporate and tourism clients. 
- Researched, developed and presented new business pitches for potential clients, winning client pitches.
- Coordinated monthly and weekly reporting from 27 markets on behalf of Egypt Tourism Authority
profile_positions.title: Senior Account Executive

profile_positions.description:
- Managed day to day liaison with in-resort PR’s and a global network of 14 agencies including UK, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, USA, Japan and Hong Kong. 
- Organised internal PR conference for 50 delegates from both agency and in-house teams.  
- Developed PR plans and high profile media campaigns, PR budget with VP communications.
profile_positions.title: PR Executive
